name: 8.3 "A Bar Is Born?" Online Trivia | 'Cheers'- Season 8 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Robin send to Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
a watch.

	Rebecca asked "Does anyone know what time it is?" because Robin sent her a new watch and couldn't read the time. She was also bragging once again that her new boyfriend was rich.

questions.text: Who teased Rebecca about not going to bed with Robin?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Rebecca told him she wanted to go to bed with him, but was waiting for the right time. Sam replied "Maybe that's why he gave you that watch."

questions.correct: Rebecca asked him to fill the pretzel bowls
options: He didn't get the raise he wanted
questions.explanation:
Rebecca asked him to fill the pretzel bowls.

	Sam said he was fed up with his life. He wanted a change.

questions.text: What advice did Frasier give Sam?
questions.explanation:
getting a career change.

	Frasier said, "Perhaps a career change would be in order, for example getting one." Sam took Frasier's advice and looked into changing his life by maybe starting a new bar of his own.

questions.text: Where was Robin in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Switzerland.

	Robin's job often had him out of the country. Based on what Rebecca said when talking to Robin on the phone, his job had something to do with world peace.

questions.text: What did Sam want to call the bar he planned to buy?
questions.explanation:
Sam's Place.

	Sam dreaded telling Rebecca that he was leaving Cheers to open his own bar. He wrote her a beautiful note, but then ended it with "PS be at my place in two hours naked and ready."

questions.text: Complete this line spoken by Norm: "Women you can't live with them __________."
questions.explanation:
pass the beer nuts.

	Normally the saying is "women you can't live with them, you can't live without them". However, Norm is not fond of his wife so to him you simply can't live with them.

questions.text: Why did Woody say that Robin went out with Rebecca when she hasn't slept with him?
options: He had nothing else to do that night.
He was hoping to find a wife.
questions.explanation:
He was a gentleman.

	Carla suggested that perhaps Robin was impotent. Norm suggested that Robin had a lot of women on the side.

questions.text: Did Robin think Sam's new bar would succeed?
questions.explanation:
No.

	He said Sam was trying to open up the same business in the same location that just failed. Robin talked to Sam about his ideas, and then he convinced Sam it wouldn't work so he could buy the bar himself.

questions.text: In the end, what did Sam decide he really wanted?
options: To go back to pitching for the Red Sox
To get married and raise a family
questions.explanation:
Cheers.

	Robin asked Sam, "Do you want any bar or do you want the best bar?" Sam decided not to settle but to buy back Cheers.
